posts.post_content: Play with just [Bone Saw](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bone Saw) and [Sigil of Distinction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sigil of Distinction) (where X is 1) and you can equip him very cheaply or swing for 3 or 4 on turn two with [Kor Duelist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kor Duelist). Use [Kor Skyfisher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kor Skyfisher) for "free" by returning your equips. Not a tournament winning deck perhaps, but it will punish midrange and greedy people who keep marginal hands.
posts.html:
Play with just Bone Saw and Sigil of Distinction (where X is 1) and you can equip him very cheaply or swing for 3 or 4 on turn two with Kor Duelist. Use Kor Skyfisher for "free" by returning your equips. Not a tournament winning deck perhaps, but it will punish midrange and greedy people who keep marginal hands.

Nifty little guy. If only there was a decent thing to equip him with., this could be central to a deck. As it stands now, I can't think of anything that makes him better than Honor of the Pure. In Worldwake, though, if there is a good equipment card, this guy will probably see play.

@MagicStick: Those things are not consistent/ self effective enough to be good outside of limited.

@Gilgiga: Equipment cards, only slightly less than Auras, have to be amazing to get any play whatsoever. Now, if we get something like Jitte in Zendikar, yeah, Kor.dec could easily be built around this guy. Otherwise, soldiers get more love, and want to include a few Kor. In otherwords, you want to include cards in an aggro deck that are good on their own merit, not just cards that are only good if you draw the doublestrike guy or Armament master.

posts.post_content: The Kor Tribe has some great potential. I've got a Kor deck that is built around these guys. Try to get them and a bunch of cheap equipment out and you can be dropping 5/5 Kor creatures out for 2 mana on turn 3. Combine this card with Conqueror's Pledge and that can be very difficult to beat. I hope that Worldwake has some equipment that meshes well with this strategy.

posts.post_content: I went to the pre-release and I have to say that I disagree. There are plenty of viable equipments in this set alone that compliment this guy perfectly. [Explorer's Scope](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Explorer's Scope) for instance is an an innocuous little 1 drop that lets you get lands out just for attackting, combine that with [Trusty Machete](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trusty Machete) or even better [Adventuring Gear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Adventuring Gear) and he has the potential to get huge while boosting all other Kors to hue status too.
posts.html:

Posted By: Batstewart (11/5/2009 12:28:43 PM)

posts.post_content:
The machete doesn't need to be self effective, the Kor tribe has two other equipment dudes at this point, Outfitter of which allows you to byp\*\*\* the downside of grappling hook, and the Duelist is pretty nuts with anything on him, he's happy with a scope, and even better with a machete.  
  
It's not proven yet, but the synergy the tribe has with equipment should make the weapons a little more playable then they would be normally.
posts.html:

It's not proven yet, but the synergy the tribe has with equipment should make the weapons a little more playable then they would be normally.
